zone.line: [f. 20r is blank]
Earth can console, Heaven can torment no
more
Panthea
Hast thou forgotten one who watches thee
The cold dark night, & never sleeps but when
The shadow of thy spirit falls on her?
Prometheus
I said all hope was vain but love—thou lovest...

line.del: But the eastern star is pale

zone.line: Deeply Panthea looks wan
In truth most deeply — but the Eastern star is
And Asia waits in that far Indian vale
The scene of her sad exile—tho her presence
rugged once
And desolate & frozen like this ravine;
But now invested with fair flowers & herbs
And haunted by sweet air's & sounds, which flow
Among the woods & waters: from the ether
Of her transforming presence—which would fade
If it were mingled not with thine—farewell
